comment: I had to withdrawal  cause of some bad medical issues but while I could participate in class she was great! It was sadly all pre-recorded but that meant you could watch any classes whenever you want, and if you don't get something she is great to email and responded immediately. There was a ton of homework but it was exactly like the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Don't expect to learn anything they used MML for everything and overloads on homework/assignments. Generally a poor communicator for an online teacher, would wait till the last second to email about issues with assignments/tests giving little to no time for resolutions. Threatens to report students to SCAI like it's nothing. Just take someone else!

I could've gotten a higher grade if I did better on the exams, but I didn't have time. The practice exams are basically the same as the real ones very easy, just with different #s. If you've used MyMathLab before, you're golden (use study plan on my MML). Strict about your background for exams, but she values communication. Take this class online.

Professor Ana is a wonderful linear algebra teacher. I will say she has very strict rules when it comes to turning in assignments and test on time. But this semester she was very very gracious towards me when i t came to turning in assignments. As long as you communicate with her and actually put forth the effort, she will  meet you half way!

Very unhelpful teacher never regretted taking a class more than this one. Barely interact with her throughout the semester, relies mostly on MyLab. Constantly threatened to report students to SCAI for everything not to her liking from calculators to camera lighting and even administrator side technical errors with no real chance of a resolutions.

Make sure you have a four function calculator, don't do work early because she will not grade early. It took nearly a month for her to tell me that my TI-30XIIS calculator was not permitted, and she will not let it slide and will report you to SCAI. She also won't mention WHY a 4 function calculator is needed.

professor has unachievable standards for online testing, and is very strict about them. she threatens to refer you for academic discipline for not having the computer very far away from you so she can see your paper the whole time. yes, academic integrity is important in online classes, but these standards are very unrealistic for most students.

Took her in person. The study guides have detailed solutions and resemble the tests. The homework is due in batches every two weeks at 11:59 PM. If you do it all at once like I did, it takes about 4-6 hours. That's the hardest part of the class. The rest is quite managable. She also has a pleasant personality and is patient with explaining things.

Took her online, expect to learn 80% of content on your own via MML Pearson (much worse than Aleks). Uses proctorU which is a pain bc you have to find an available time slot to take your exam (good times are almost always booked up). HW takes hours and is basically every day. There are MUCH better 3260 professors just save yourself the stress.

Took her online. Homework assignments take hours (Pearson), doesn't give much insight in lectures, and expects you to learn on your own on MML. Doesn't give reminders when random 'written assignments',discussion posts, or 'scientific writing' assignments are due (its a math class? why am I writing?). If I could give her a 0 I would.

Uses old notes written in cursive making it sometimes quite hard to read, Has many benign graded participation assignments that have nothing to do with your math capabilities, and has her assignments due at 5pm rather than 11:59 like any other professor. Only 3260 professor to use ProctorU for exams. Slow to respond to emails. Take someone else.
Very kind professor that cares about her students. The class is difficult but she is more than willing to help if you ask for it.

She is really nice and understanding. She replies within a couple of minutes which is really helpful and shows that she cares about her students. There have been multiple times where I emailed her and she replied fast so I wasn't just sitting there waiting for her. Overall, she is a great teacher if you put in the work.

Dr. Croicu was a great and helpful professor. She always answered emails and addressed any concerns that I had. Also, she remembered me years later when I asked her for a recommendation. I would recommend taking her.

Ms., Croicu is a very good teacher. She has a minor accent, I'm guessing somewhere in south-America. She is very straight forward and will tell you what you're lacking and how to work on it. Pretty cool teacher, I thought for sure I was going to fail, but she gave out lots of extra credit she didn't need to give out.
Overall, very enjoyable.

Took her for online. Biggest mistake I ever made. I usually thrive in math classes.She doesn't teach at all, only offers assistance when you email her. You teach yourself on MML, the homework takes hours upon hours to finish each week, and the tests are on ProctorU which is even worse than LockDown. Test 1 and 2 are 10% each while the final is 30%.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I will say she does get back to you very quickly via email however, she relies too heavily on MYMATHLAB especially during the summer semester. So much extra crap for homework to do that it was ridiculous. It was difficult for a class that did not need to be difficult. took two other classes so if you are only taking this class its fine. Study!!!!!!
I literally only heard her voice during the 5 minute intro video. She completely relys on the ALEKS system and associated e-book to teach her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Never regretted taking a class more. I have never gotten below an A in a math class and let's just say that didn't happen this semester. You have to pay for online test proctoring and we use Aleks for everything. I didn't learn anything and wasn't provided with resources to help me do well in this class. Don't take Professor Croicu at least online.

While she is a very nice and accommodating professor, she does essentially nothing to teach the class. The entire class is taken through the ALEKS program. All she really did was enter the grades from ALEKS into D2L. 3 proctored tests including the final. Through proctorU. Final is worth 25% and is incredibly difficult. Class average was failing.

I took her class online and honestly I don't understand what's the point of her leading the class when she didn't do any of the teaching. If I had known the class was a self-taught/ one where your only tool is ALEKs I would not have taken the class. I'm already bad at math as is why would I try to teach myself the subject.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Great teacher for Linear Algebra I. Lots of easy homework, two tests, and a final exam that counts for 40% of your grade. No calculators, but if you know the material like you should, you won't need one. She answers questions during class, via email quickly, and in her office. She has a bit of an accent but is a very honest and caring professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: By far the worst teacher i have ever taken online. She makes 3 exams throughout the year proctored and you can only use 1 specific calculator (practically useless) and they are weighted so that if you fail those 3 then there is no way to pass. She is useless as far as trying to get help and material is almost possible to teach yourself. STAY AWAY!!

Terrible teacher, Can't use calculators all year and you have to write sentences to explain how to solve each problem and how you got each answer. I struggled in this class especially because I didn't have enough time to take the test without a calculator and having to write sentences took up too much time. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS OR PROFESSOR!

I had a very bad time with this class, attendance is graded and the lectures are extremely dry. She does not allow calculators on her tests, and now she is requiring us to write 2 sentences explaining our answers to every problem. This is probably the most rude and uncaring professor I have ever had. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

she does NOT let you use calculators at all on any test. test are exactly like the practice test given out the day before ur exam, just with different numbers. its easy to pass the test if u memorize the practice test and shell require you to write a sentence for each problem explaining what you did to solve
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont waste your time! Heavy accent, teaches content pretty fast, does not allow calculators on tests, and asks for written responses on some of them. I always used calculators on everything so this was pretty difficult for me. I suggest you practice math without using a calculator. I honestly had to teach myself in that class.  Dont do it !
Study for tests. Make sure you're able to solve all the types of problems given throughout lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Don't take this class online. There are 4 homework assignments that are 100 questions each. There are 4 discussions based off of the homework. 3 of the tests are proctored which you have to pay $20 for each. Not easy to teach yourself.

You will be required to use the Pearson textbook exclusively (no other content provided by prof). You also have to pay $20 for each exam, which there are 3. Homework has to be typed out and formatted in Word, all 200 problems. The textbook is all computation and no theory. I would rather not waste my time here and would learn more with self study.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor. If you do what she asks of you then this class is not hard. She asks you to do 8 problems of homework a night that are due the day of your test. She gives you a practice test with the answers written in the format she wants. She pulls all 6 test problems exactly from the practice test just with different numbers.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 4 homework with 100 questions each that take a ton of time but just grind it out. I logged in over 80 hours for the summer class while working full time so it is possible. DO THE PRACTICE TESTS! There are VERY similar to the test and give you 5 extra points towards your final grade. Tests aren't hard if you do the homework and the practice test.

I did not have a good time with this class. I have a mostly A average in all math classes because I study hard and work hard, and this class destroyed me. 2 tests- 4/5 problems on each one but be prepared because you must write the definitions and thereoms for EVERY step or she counts of points. Class averages were below 70's for both tests. avoid.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Lectures are boring but the practice tests are all you need.

Two 99 question homework assignments that take hours on end to complete. They clearly didn't help that much because both the class midterm averages were not good. Lectures are boring and she doesn't make much sense. She is terrible at entering grades in a timely manner. All in all, she made the class way more difficult than it needed to be.

You have to show up, but the lectures are dry. The homework (MML) is tedious/time-consuming. The tests require you to answer using theorems. The final is easy but it is 40%, so prepare. This class wasn't inherently difficult, it just requires you to be a good test-taker and know what your talking about. She's tough on grading too, so get ready.

This class was broken into 2 exams, each with half the course material. She makes the homework, project and test due all on the same day. This should not be a hard course, yet this was one of the most painful I have ever been in. Do yourself a favor and sign up for someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Man I wish there were more tags because there are none pertaining to this woman. Thick accent, which impedes learning. I am a 3.7 student at UGA now, and I can say this is the worst prof I've ever had. I am warning you, please, do not take her.. No lenience policy, to the second. Doesn't sound like someone who passionately cares about kids learning

she is so boring I used to sleep in every class the problem is that I love math and i  used to get A in all my math courses  but i think i will get b or maybe c if i didn't do well in the final because the final has 40% of the grade she is like history teacher i had some problem with her accent as well she is nice person but not as a math teacher

I am currently receiving an A in this course, but if you have the chance to take her, avoid it. It is a doable class so if your schedule will only work with her, it is definitely possible to do well, she is just very boring and really tough on grading tests.

online tests are PROCTORED, so if you are not set up for a person staring at you for the time allotted, then be prepared to spend a significant amount of additional money to  do this.  It's definitely intimidating, and can cause some testing anxiety.

I took pre-calculus as an online class, which was my fault-not the professor's.  The first module was heavy and she gave enough time to complete the work, but then things sped up from there.  She did offer extra credit on the last work assignment, but I did not complete it, or the last test or final, and failed. TIME MANAGEMENT IS ESSENTIAL!!!

I took this Pre-Calc class online and it is NOT easy to do online. I put in the work but its just very hard to teach yourself from just the MyMathLab and their materials. Be prepared to do Discussion problems for each section as that is part of your grade. She seems nice enough otherwise but I feel she could have been more of a help.

Shames students for not matching her rote standards. Yes, rote. She basically expects a test or quiz to completely match her rubric or she takes off 20% for every single mismatch even if the answer and the method is right or at least acceptable. So you can get an F for a correct answer with a little mistake.

Pros: Does not require the expensive textbook and posts the questions online. Also pretty tolerant for tardiness.  Cons: Grades too harshly. For instance blames it on the students when they get averages around 60% while most people get the question right but not the little details she is so merciless about. Unclear about what exactly she wants.

DO NOT add this course during drop/add. KSU and Pearson software both have gateways to switch on before you can actually start working. By the time I had been set up with this I already had two zeros from missing the assignments while these gateways were tuned on. After emailing the professor, she politely told me to pound sand.

Very helpful and encouraging. I took her class online and making an A wasn't challenging as long as you put the time in to do the work. You just have to make sure you are able to teach yourself from the powerpoints and examples on MyMathLab. I have no complaints :)

I took her online. She is very helpful. I would say the discussion part was the most difficult. But she's easy. She grades on a point system. If you dnt mind reading power points & teaching yourself go for it! :)
This teacher is helpful whenevr you need it. She is always willing to do her best.

Ok.  This course is Math-3000, aka- Software of Mathematics.  She is the only teacher who teaches it and the Prerequisite is Calc-1 only!  We are currently doing differential Equations  and Calc-2 work in class. She has us writing programs without any CS classes required and she is bad at writing English.  Luckily I am a CS major who passed Calc-3.

I took this class online. It was pretty challenging as I am not a math person at all. Dr. Croicu was not as helpful as previous math teachers I've had, but I think my C is mostly due to taking the course online instead of in a classroom. Don't take the course online. She wasn't a terrible prof though.

I am NOT a math person. I took her class online and it was wonderful! Everything is on GeorgiaView & MyMathLab. She makes notes for every section and posts on GVV. There are 4 homework assignments, 4 Tests, weekly discussion posts, and a final. Prof. is very helpful, highly recommend this class to those willing to read and learn.

She is such a sweet and helpful person. Took this pre cal class online and it was the best class. There are four test and a final. She assigns a lot of homework but if you do every problem you will without a doubt pass the test! Recommend recommend recommend!

Teaching is her strong suit. Loves her students to death, and goes the extra mile to check in on them (even long after graduation.) Will devote office time to assist in topics and is knowledgeable in the material she is teaching. Loved her courses, and I highly recommend you take her courses.

class was not hard if you are good in math. if not, stay away. took online and fairly easy. gives alot of homework - 100 prob. then you have to take test which is similar to quiz (not mandatory). also must do discussions. This is why i got a b rather than an a. disliked discussions which can impact your grade if you dont do well on test.

Eventhough I didn't know what to expect and I struggled in the class, I still thought it was fun.  I had decided not to drop the class because I enjoyed coming, even if I was failing.  The professor does care if you understand and is willing to help you.

Has a strong Romanian accent which you get used to but overall a good professor. The practice quizzes and tests helped out a lot since it's very similar to the actual quiz or test. She tends to move fast and doesn't really take the time to help students personally but overall a good professor for Calculus.

She has a strong accent...makes it hard to understand at times. She gives practice test and quizzes prior to the exams She made homework mandatory, way too many problems she gave no less than 70 something problems...graded 5 problems randomly and everything else was effort math isnt my subject, I had a hard time in the class but overall she is okay

she is an amazing teacher. her accent is a little hard to understand but she gives practice quizzes and tests which are almost identical to the actual quizzes an tests. she will explain anything that you ask until you understand. great teacher.

Dr. Croicu is amazing.  I can not imagine a Calculus class being any easier than she made it.  She gives a practice quiz right before you take the real one.  She gives a practice exam the day before the test.  She explains things VERY WELL.  She is very willing to help outside of class as well.  I strongly recommend her!
Attendance isn't mandatory, but she gives weekly quizzes. Overall, I think she's great; she's always willing to help, and she tries to make the class as easy as possible.

Mrs. Criocu is the best math teacher I have ever had. She breaks things down completely and explains them very well. Before every quiz and test there is a practice quiz/test and she only changes slight things which helps a lot! She is a very sweet lady. She does have an accent but you will get used to it. TAKE THIS CLASS...EASY A!!

Sweet teacher, yah she has an acent but doesn't really get in the way. Very smart and helpful, will take time outside of class to help u. Doesn't review homework in class. U get practice test and quizzes before each test or quiz. I got a B with very very little effort, but im good in math, so try a little ask questions outside of class, and u shoul

Awsome teacher. She tries to make the material easy.  Never before have I had a math teacher make difficult concepts so easy to understand.  But the best selling point to her class is simply this: she gives practice quizes immediately before the quizes and she also gives practice exams.  Made me miss the good old days in high school with worksheets

Her accent gets in the way a lot and sometimes impairs learning- but she teaches straight out of the book.  All quizzes, tests, and exams have a practice quiz before making the class very easy.  Just do your homework and ask questions about hte practice quizzes and you should be fine

VERY VERY HARD!!! horrible calculus teacher..ten quizzes, three tests, and a cumulative final. not lenient at all so you better show up to class. she takes attendance DAILY. I wouldn't recommend unless you are great at math.

She was a very good teacher.  Each day was pretty much the same.  She went over the notes slowly and explained everything.  She is not into memorizing things- more about understanding.  Before esch quiz we got a pratice quiz 2 questions. The quiz was the same as the pratice quiz but with diff numbers. She also gave out pratice tests with ans online
